title: How to Post Big Pictures on Instagram

methods.name: Splitting Up an Image on Android

steps.headline: Download and install 9Square.
steps.description: 9Square is an app that can divide your images into smaller images and upload them to Instagram. Use the following steps to download 9Square for Android. Open the Google Play Store. Type "9Square" in the search bar at the top. Tap 9Square in the search results. Tap Install.

steps.headline: Open 9Square.
steps.description: 9Square has a blue icon with a white 3x3 grid. You can tap Open in the Google Play Store to open 9Square, or you can tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open 9Square.

steps.headline: Tap the image icon in the middle.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a stack of photos on the 9Square title screen. The first time you open 9Square you will be asked if you want to allow 9Square to access your images and media files, tap Allow to continue.

steps.headline: Select an image source.
steps.description: Tap one of the icons to select a source. Tap Camera to take a picture with your camera. Tap Files to open an image from your files folder. Tap Gallery to open an image in your gallery.

steps.headline: Select an image.
steps.description: Either use your camera to take a picture, or tap an image you want to divide and upload to Instagram.

steps.headline: Select a grid type.
steps.description: Tap one of the grid formats at the top to select a grid type. Select 3x1 for a single row of images. 3x2 is good for a 16:9 widescreen photo. 3x3 is good for square images. 3x4 is good for wider portrait images, and 3x5 is good for tall portrait images. You can upload a 3x1 row to your feed as a single row of images that people can view by swiping left on the image in their feed.

steps.headline: Adjust the image cropping.
steps.description: Tap and drag the square in the center of the image to position over the image  Tap and drag the corners of the square to enlarge it. This square and the thin white lines in the middle indicate how the image will be cut apart when you crop it.

steps.headline: Tap Crop.
steps.description: This displays a screen that shows the image after it's been cropped  It also indicates the order the images should be uploaded to Instagram in.

steps.headline: Tap Save All.
steps.description: This crops the image and saves the images to your phone in a separate album.

steps.headline: Type a name for the album.
steps.description: Name it something descriptive like "[Photo name] Grid" or something similar.

steps.headline: Tap Save.
steps.description: This saves the cropped image to the new folder.

methods.name: Splitting Up an Image on iPhone

steps.headline: Download and install 9SquareforInstagram.
steps.description: 9SquareforInstagram is an app that can divide your images into smaller images and upload them to Instagram. Use the following steps to download 9Square for iPhone. Open the App Store. Tap the Search tab. Type "9Square" in the search bar at the top. Tap 9Square in the search results. Tap GET next to 9SquareforInstagram.

steps.headline: Open 9SquareforInstagram.
steps.description: It has a purple icon with a white 3x3 square. Tap the icon on your home scree to open 9SquareforInstram, or tap Open when if finishes downloading in the App Store.

steps.headline: Tap Start.
steps.description: It's below the image on the Title Screen.

steps.headline: Tap Camera or Library.
steps.description: If you want to take a picture, tap Camera. If you want to use a photo from your Camera Roll, tap Library.

steps.headline: Tap a grid type.
steps.description: Tap one of the grid formats at the bottom to select a grid type. Select 3x1 for a single row of images. 3x2 is good for a 16:9 widescreen photo. 3x3 is good for square images. 3x4 is good for wider portrait images. You can upload a 3x1 row to your feed as a single row of images that people can view by swiping left on the image in their feed.

steps.headline: Adjust the cropping.
steps.description: You will see a preview of how the image will be cropped in the center. Tap and drag the image to adjust the image will be cropped. Place your thumb and index finger on the image and spread them apart to enlarge the image.

steps.headline: Tap the checkmark icon.
steps.description: It's in the upper-right corner. This crops the images and saves them.

steps.headline: Tap Ok.
steps.description: When you see the alert that says the images were saved, tap Ok.

steps.headline: Open Instagram.
steps.description: It has a rainbow-colored icon that resembles a camera. Tap the Instagram icon on your home screen or apps menu to open Instagram.

steps.headline: Tap +.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen in the center. This is the icon to create a new post.

steps.headline: Select the image that goes in the bottom right corner.
steps.description: It's important that you upload the images in the right order for this to work properly. The first image you want to upload is the one that goes in the bottom-right corner of the grid.

steps.headline: Tap Next.
steps.description: It's in the upper-right corner. This displays the filters page.

steps.headline: Select a filter for your image (optional) and tap Next.
steps.description: If you want to select a filter for your image, tap the filter you want to use at the bottom. Otherwise, tap Next in the upper-right corner to continue. If you do use an image filter, be sure to use the same filter for all your images in order to keep them consistent.

steps.headline: Tap Share.
steps.description: This posts the image to Instagram.

steps.headline: Upload the rest of the images.
steps.description: You'll need to upload each image individually. Repeat the steps above to upload the rest of the images. Make sure you are uploading them in the right order. You've already uploaded the first image in the bottom-right corner. Upload the bottom-center image next. Then upload the bottom-left image. Move to the next row up and continue uploading images from right to left. Continue until you have uploaded each of the images. To upload a single row of images to your feed, tap the "+" icon. Tap Select Multiple on Android, or tap and hold the first image on iPhone. Select the images in your row starting from right to left. Upload the photos and swipe left on the image in your feed to view the entire image.

steps.headline: Tap your profile image.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a person in the lower-right corner. You will see your images appear as a grid on your profile.

text: Splitting Up an Image on Android Download and install 9Square. 9Square is an app that can divide your images into smaller images and upload them to Instagram. Use the following steps to download 9Square for Android. Open the Google Play Store. Type "9Square" in the search bar at the top. Tap 9Square in the search results. Tap Install. Open 9Square. 9Square has a blue icon with a white 3x3 grid. You can tap Open in the Google Play Store to open 9Square, or you can tap the icon on your home screen or apps menu to open 9Square. Tap the image icon in the middle. It's the icon that resembles a stack of photos on the 9Square title screen. The first time you open 9Square you will be asked if you want to allow 9Square to access your images and media files, tap Allow to continue. Select an image source. Tap one of the icons to select a source. Tap Camera to take a picture with your camera. Tap Files to open an image from your files folder. Tap Gallery to open an image in your gallery. Select an image. Either use your camera to take a picture, or tap an image you want to divide and upload to Instagram. Select a grid type. Tap one of the grid formats at the top to select a grid type. Select 3x1 for a single row of images. 3x2 is good for a 16:9 widescreen photo. 3x3 is good for square images. 3x4 is good for wider portrait images, and 3x5 is good for tall portrait images. You can upload a 3x1 row to your feed as a single row of images that people can view by swiping left on the image in their feed. Adjust the image cropping. Tap and drag the square in the center of the image to position over the image  Tap and drag the corners of the square to enlarge it. This square and the thin white lines in the middle indicate how the image will be cut apart when you crop it. Tap Crop. This displays a screen that shows the image after it's been cropped  It also indicates the order the images should be uploaded to Instagram in. Tap Save All. This crops the image and saves the images to your phone in a separate album. Type a name for the album. Name it something descriptive like "[Photo name] Grid" or something similar. Tap Save. This saves the cropped image to the new folder. Splitting Up an Image on iPhone Download and install 9SquareforInstagram. 9SquareforInstagram is an app that can divide your images into smaller images and upload them to Instagram. Use the following steps to download 9Square for iPhone. Open the App Store. Tap the Search tab. Type "9Square" in the search bar at the top. Tap 9Square in the search results. Tap GET next to 9SquareforInstagram. Open 9SquareforInstagram. It has a purple icon with a white 3x3 square. Tap the icon on your home scree to open 9SquareforInstram, or tap Open when if finishes downloading in the App Store. Tap Start. It's below the image on the Title Screen. Tap Camera or Library. If you want to take a picture, tap Camera. If you want to use a photo from your Camera Roll, tap Library. Tap a grid type. Tap one of the grid formats at the bottom to select a grid type. Select 3x1 for a single row of images. 3x2 is good for a 16:9 widescreen photo. 3x3 is good for square images. 3x4 is good for wider portrait images. You can upload a 3x1 row to your feed as a single row of images that people can view by swiping left on the image in their feed. Adjust the cropping. You will see a preview of how the image will be cropped in the center. Tap and drag the image to adjust the image will be cropped. Place your thumb and index finger on the image and spread them apart to enlarge the image. Tap the checkmark icon. It's in the upper-right corner. This crops the images and saves them. Tap Ok. When you see the alert that says the images were saved, tap Ok. Uploading the images to Instagram Open Instagram. It has a rainbow-colored icon that resembles a camera. Tap the Instagram icon on your home screen or apps menu to open Instagram. Tap +. It's at the bottom of the screen in the center. This is the icon to create a new post. Select the image that goes in the bottom right corner. It's important that you upload the images in the right order for this to work properly. The first image you want to upload is the one that goes in the bottom-right corner of the grid. Tap Next. It's in the upper-right corner. This displays the filters page. Select a filter for your image (optional) and tap Next. If you want to select a filter for your image, tap the filter you want to use at the bottom. Otherwise, tap Next in the upper-right corner to continue. If you do use an image filter, be sure to use the same filter for all your images in order to keep them consistent. Tap Share. This posts the image to Instagram. Upload the rest of the images. You'll need to upload each image individually. Repeat the steps above to upload the rest of the images. Make sure you are uploading them in the right order. You've already uploaded the first image in the bottom-right corner. Upload the bottom-center image next. Then upload the bottom-left image. Move to the next row up and continue uploading images from right to left. Continue until you have uploaded each of the images. To upload a single row of images to your feed, tap the "+" icon. Tap Select Multiple on Android, or tap and hold the first image on iPhone. Select the images in your row starting from right to left. Upload the photos and swipe left on the image in your feed to view the entire image. Tap your profile image. It's the icon that resembles a person in the lower-right corner. You will see your images appear as a grid on your profile.
